title: Enthusiasm for the Great Awakening - who

content.question: Which of the following groups was LEAST likely to respond with enthusiasm to the religious fervor of the Great Awakening in the 1730s and 1740s?

choices.label: Established merchants in cities like Boston and Philadelphia
Backwoods farmers isolated on the colonial frontier
Landless sons in New England communities
Itinerant preachers unable to find permanent parishes for themselves

content.answer: Established merchants in cities like Boston and Philadelphia

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
